speakers.title: JAM Stack: The Total Victory of JavaScript
speakers.name: Shawn swyx Wang
speakers.description:
A lot has happened in the five years since Val Karpov coined the MEAN stack to describe "Full Stack" Javascript stacks.
React rose to dominance, AWS Lambda started the Serverless movement, and Static Site Generators came back in a big way. 


What is driving this new stack of Javascript, APIs, and Markup? This is the story of how a JAM Stack cynic finally turned into a believer.

speakers.title: Having fun with HTTP/2 in Node.js
speakers.name: James M Snell
speakers.description: Fun stuff you can do with HTTP/2! Including some best practices and future plans of HTTP2 in Node.

speakers.title: Get Over Yourself
speakers.name: Adam Smith
speakers.description: A humbling look into Imposter Syndrome and realizing youâ€™re not the only one. Getting comfortable with being uncomfortable is something we all need to get comfortable with.

speakers.title: Narrative Visualizations
speakers.name: Zev Youra
speakers.description:
I recently left Google after ~4.5 years to work on some new projects. Since then, I've been spending most of my time working on multi-layered data visualizations, and would love to talk through the creation of a few examples. I could also discuss the workflow I've developed to present them both as interactive visualizations on the web and as pre-rendered videos for consumption on twitter, facebook, etc.

...on the other hand, I may have some new ideas by next year, so let's circle back a bit beforehand to make sure this is still the best topic.
